text:
Is there some syntax for passing a generator to a function taking variadic args? e.g.
```hcat([i, i, i] for i in 1:10)```
I know I can splat an array, but the intermediate array seems unnecessary
```hcat([[i, i, i[ for i in 1:10]...)```
Thanks!

elements.text: Is there some syntax for passing a generator to a function taking variadic args? e.g.
hcat([i, i, i] for i in 1:10)
I know I can splat an array, but the intermediate array seems unnecessary
hcat([[i, i, i[ for i in 1:10]...)

text: Can we cross post this publicly to <https://discourse.julialang.org|Discourse> for further visibility? React with :bridge: on the message above to approve. <https://github.com/JuliaCommunity/SlackBridge/blob/main/README.md#faq|More info here>

Success, it has been cross posted <https://discourse.julialang.org/t/55743| to Discourse>. Keep and eye out on Discourse for responses and please add an answer there once you are satisfied with the solution so others can benefit as well. Happy debugging!
`hcat(([i, i, i] for i in 1:10)...)` perhaps

elements.text: hcat(([i, i, i] for i in 1:10)...)

text: Ah, this avoids the intermediate allocation. Thanks!

elements.text: Ah, this avoids the intermediate allocation. Thanks!

text: Also `reduce(hcat, [i, i, i] for i in 1:100)`, but that seems slower for some rerason

elements.text: reduce(hcat, [i, i, i] for i in 1:100)
, but that seems slower for some rerason
